vision: A comprehensive web-based management interface for Claude agents, skills, and MCP servers with visual workflow automation

target_audience.primary: Developers and technical teams who want to visually manage and execute Claude AI agents without CLI complexity
secondary: AI/ML engineers building agent-based automation workflows
DevOps teams setting up AI-powered tooling and integrations
Technical product managers overseeing AI agent deployments
Solo developers exploring Claude API capabilities

phases.name: Foundation & Security
phases.description: Establish critical security, complete core functionality gaps, and fix technical debt to make the platform production-ready

milestones.title: Secure Access Control
milestones.description: Users can securely authenticate and access the platform with proper session management

milestones.title: Complete Agent Execution Experience
milestones.description: Agent execution is fully functional with input fields, conversation management, and real-time streaming

milestones.title: Production-Ready Backend
milestones.description: All simulated API calls replaced with real implementations, technical debt resolved

phases.name: Analytics & Visibility
phases.description: Add comprehensive analytics, monitoring, and visibility features to help users understand agent performance and usage

milestones.title: Agent Analytics Dashboard
milestones.description: Users have full visibility into agent execution history, success rates, and performance metrics

milestones.title: Skill Intelligence
milestones.description: Comprehensive skill usage tracking and training insights available

phases.name: Automation & Scheduling
phases.description: Enable scheduled executions, version control, and advanced agent management capabilities

milestones.title: Scheduled Automation
milestones.description: Agents and flows can run on schedules without manual intervention

milestones.title: Version Control & Safety
milestones.description: Agents have version history with rollback capabilities for safe experimentation

milestones.title: Enhanced Agent Creation
milestones.description: Agent templates and improved MCP configuration streamline setup

phases.name: Collaboration & Teams
phases.description: Enable team collaboration, sharing, and multi-user workflows

milestones.title: Team Workspaces
milestones.description: Multiple users can collaborate within team workspaces with role-based access

milestones.title: Agent Collaboration
milestones.description: Agents can be chained together and shared across teams

phases.name: Scale & Enterprise
phases.description: Enterprise-grade features for large deployments, compliance, and extensibility

milestones.title: Enterprise Security
milestones.description: SSO integration and comprehensive audit logging for enterprise compliance

milestones.title: Platform Extensibility
milestones.description: Plugin system and API management for custom integrations

milestones.title: Community & Marketplace
milestones.description: Share and discover workflows, templates, and plugins from the community

features.title: User Authentication & Authorization
features.description: Implement a complete authentication system with user registration, login, password management, and role-based access control. This is critical for production deployments and team usage.
features.rationale: Without authentication, the platform cannot be safely deployed in production or used by teams. This is the most critical gap preventing real-world adoption. All current API routes lack authentication, creating a security vulnerability.
acceptance_criteria: Users can register new accounts with email and password
Users can log in and receive JWT tokens for API access
Users can log out and invalidate their sessions
Password reset flow via email is functional
Protected routes require valid authentication tokens
Role-based access control limits actions based on user roles (admin, user)
Session management with configurable expiration works correctly
user_stories: As a developer, I want to log in to my account so that I can securely access my agents and configurations
As an admin, I want to manage user roles so that I can control who has access to sensitive operations
As a user, I want to reset my password so that I can regain access if I forget it

features.title: Agent Execution Input Fields
features.description: Implement the input fields feature for agent execution, allowing users to define required inputs and provide values before running an agent. This includes adding the inputFields schema to Strapi and building the UI components.
features.rationale: The input fields feature is documented but not implemented, preventing users from creating agents that require dynamic inputs. This blocks common use cases like parameterized agents for different tasks.
acceptance_criteria: Agents can define input fields with name, type, description, and required flag
Input field types include: text, number, boolean, select, textarea
Agent execution UI shows input form when agent has defined input fields
Validation prevents execution if required fields are missing
Input values are passed to the agent execution context
Input field configuration is stored in Strapi schema
user_stories: As a developer, I want to define input parameters for my agent so that it can be reused with different inputs
As a user, I want to fill in required inputs before running an agent so that it has the context it needs

features.title: Complete Conversation Management
features.description: Fully implement conversation retrieval and deletion endpoints that are currently marked as not implemented. Enable users to view conversation history and clean up old conversations.
features.rationale: Conversation management endpoints are stubbed but not functional, preventing users from reviewing past agent interactions or managing storage. This limits the value of the chat feature.
acceptance_criteria: GET /conversation/:id returns full conversation history with all messages
DELETE /conversation/:id removes the conversation and all associated messages
Conversation list endpoint with pagination is available
Conversation search by date range and content is supported
Bulk delete conversations older than X days is available
user_stories: As a user, I want to view my conversation history so that I can reference previous agent interactions
As a user, I want to delete old conversations so that I can manage my storage and privacy

features.title: Enhanced Real-Time Execution Monitoring
features.description: Improve the real-time execution monitoring with better status indicators, progress tracking, and error handling. Add execution timeline view showing step-by-step agent actions.
features.rationale: Users cited lack of real-time visibility as a major pain point. While basic SSE streaming exists, users need better visualization of what the agent is doing and why.
acceptance_criteria: Execution status shows current step (thinking, tool calling, writing, etc.)
Timeline view shows all agent actions with timestamps
Tool calls are visualized with inputs and outputs
Error states show detailed error messages and stack traces
Users can cancel running executions with confirmation
Execution duration and token usage are displayed
user_stories: As a developer, I want to see exactly what my agent is doing in real-time so that I can debug issues quickly
As a user, I want to cancel a runaway execution so that I don't waste API credits

features.title: Replace Simulated API Calls
features.description: Replace all simulated API calls (marked with TODO comments) with actual implementations. Ensure proper error handling, retry logic, and timeout management for all API interactions.
features.rationale: Technical debt from simulated API calls creates unreliable behavior and prevents proper testing. This must be resolved before production deployment.
acceptance_criteria: All TODO comments for simulated APIs are resolved
API calls include proper error handling with typed errors
Retry logic with exponential backoff for transient failures
Request timeouts are configurable per endpoint
API responses are properly validated and typed
Integration tests verify all API endpoints
user_stories: As a developer, I want reliable API calls so that my agents execute consistently
As a DevOps engineer, I want proper error handling so that I can diagnose production issues

features.title: SDK Permission Handling
features.description: Implement proper SDK hook permission handling for sensitive tool operations. Add user prompts for file system access, network requests, and other potentially dangerous operations.
features.rationale: The SDK permission handling is pending, creating potential security risks when agents access sensitive resources. Users need control over what actions agents can perform.
acceptance_criteria: Sensitive operations trigger permission prompts to users
Users can approve or deny individual tool calls
Permission policies can be configured per agent
Auto-approve rules for trusted operations are configurable
Permission decisions are logged for audit purposes
Denied operations gracefully fail with informative messages
user_stories: As a user, I want to approve sensitive operations so that I maintain control over what agents can access
As an admin, I want to configure permission policies so that agents operate within safe boundaries

features.title: Agent Analytics Dashboard
features.description: Build a comprehensive analytics dashboard showing agent execution metrics including success rates, average execution time, token usage, error rates, and usage trends over time.
features.rationale: Users lack visibility into agent performance and usage patterns. Analytics are essential for optimizing agents, managing costs, and identifying issues before they become problems.
acceptance_criteria: Dashboard shows execution count, success rate, and failure rate per agent
Charts display usage trends over configurable time periods
Token usage and estimated costs are tracked and displayed
Average execution time with percentile breakdowns is shown
Error categorization helps identify common failure patterns
Export analytics data to CSV/JSON for external analysis
Filter analytics by date range, agent, and status
user_stories: As a developer, I want to see execution metrics so that I can identify and fix underperforming agents
As a manager, I want to track token usage so that I can manage API costs effectively

features.title: Execution History & Logs
features.description: Create a searchable execution history with detailed logs for each agent run. Include filtering, sorting, and the ability to replay or debug past executions.
features.rationale: Without execution history, users cannot debug issues, audit agent behavior, or learn from past runs. This is essential for iterative agent improvement.
acceptance_criteria: All executions are logged with full context and results
Execution history is searchable by agent, date, status, and content
Detailed logs show each step of agent execution
Users can view input/output for each execution
Execution replay mode re-runs with same inputs
Pagination handles large execution histories efficiently
Retention policies manage log storage automatically
user_stories: As a developer, I want to search past executions so that I can find and analyze specific runs
As a user, I want to replay an execution so that I can verify consistent behavior

features.title: Skill Usage Analytics
features.description: Add analytics for skill usage across agents, showing which skills are most used, their success rates, and which agents use them. Include training effectiveness metrics.
features.rationale: Users struggle to track which skills are used by which agents. Analytics help optimize skill investments and identify underutilized or problematic skills.
acceptance_criteria: Dashboard shows skill usage count across all agents
Per-skill success/failure rates are tracked
Agent-skill relationship matrix is visualized
Training session metrics track improvement over time
Skill dependencies are mapped and displayed
Unused skills are highlighted for cleanup
user_stories: As a developer, I want to see which agents use which skills so that I can understand dependencies
As a user, I want to identify underperforming skills so that I can improve or replace them

features.title: Skill Training Insights
features.description: Enhance skill training with insights showing training progress, example coverage, and suggestions for improvement. Add A/B testing capabilities for skill variations.
features.rationale: Skill training via chat exists but lacks visibility into effectiveness. Users need guidance on how to improve skill quality and coverage.
acceptance_criteria: Training progress shows examples added and coverage gaps
Quality score estimates skill effectiveness
Suggestions identify areas needing more training examples
A/B testing compares different skill versions
Training history timeline shows evolution of skill
Export/import training data for backup and sharing
user_stories: As a developer, I want to see training coverage so that I know what examples to add
As a user, I want to compare skill versions so that I can choose the most effective one

features.title: Scheduled Agent Executions
features.description: Add cron-like scheduling for agent executions, allowing users to run agents automatically at specified intervals. Include execution queuing and failure retry policies.
features.rationale: Scheduled executions are a known gap that prevents automation use cases. Users need agents to run on schedules for monitoring, reporting, and maintenance tasks.
acceptance_criteria: Users can create schedules using cron syntax or simple intervals
Scheduled executions run reliably at specified times
Execution queue manages concurrent scheduled runs
Failure retry policies with configurable attempts and delays
Schedule pause/resume and one-off skip controls
Execution notifications via web push for schedule completions
Schedule conflict detection warns about overlapping runs
user_stories: As a developer, I want to schedule agents to run daily so that I automate recurring tasks
As a DevOps engineer, I want retry policies so that transient failures don't break my automation

features.title: Agent Version Control
features.description: Implement version control for agents with commit-like saves, version comparison, and rollback capabilities. Track changes to configuration, skills, and MCP server associations.
features.rationale: Agent version control is a known gap that makes experimentation risky. Users need the ability to safely iterate on agent configurations with the safety net of rollback.
acceptance_criteria: Each agent save creates a new version with timestamp and optional message
Version history shows all changes with diff view
Side-by-side comparison of any two versions
One-click rollback to any previous version
Version branching for parallel experimentation
Auto-save creates draft versions without polluting history
Version tagging for marking stable releases
user_stories: As a developer, I want to version my agents so that I can safely experiment with changes
As a user, I want to rollback to a previous version so that I can recover from mistakes

features.title: Agent Comparison & Diff View
features.description: Build tools for comparing agent configurations, showing differences in settings, skills, MCP servers, and prompts. Enable side-by-side testing of agent variations.
features.rationale: Users need to understand how agents differ to debug issues and optimize performance. Comparison tools accelerate the learning and improvement cycle.
acceptance_criteria: Select any two agents or agent versions for comparison
Diff view highlights configuration differences
Side-by-side execution with same inputs for testing
Comparison results can be exported as reports
Merge capabilities to combine best aspects of agents
user_stories: As a developer, I want to compare agents so that I understand why one performs better than another
As a user, I want to test agents side-by-side so that I can choose the best one

features.title: Agent Templates Gallery
features.description: Create a library of agent templates for common use cases including code review, documentation, data analysis, and more. Allow users to create agents from templates with customization.
features.rationale: Setting up agents requires deep technical knowledge. Templates reduce time-to-value by providing starting points that users can customize.
acceptance_criteria: Built-in templates for 10+ common use cases
Template gallery with search and category filtering
One-click agent creation from template
Templates include pre-configured skills and MCP servers
User-created templates can be saved and shared
Template preview shows capabilities before creation
Templates are versioned and updatable
user_stories: As a new user, I want to start with templates so that I can quickly get productive
As a developer, I want to create templates from my agents so that I can share best practices

features.title: Enhanced MCP Server Configuration
features.description: Improve MCP server configuration with visual JSON editor, validation, environment variable management, and configuration templates. Add guided setup wizards for popular MCP servers.
features.rationale: MCP server configuration requires manual JSON editing which is error-prone. Visual tools and templates would significantly reduce setup friction.
acceptance_criteria: Visual JSON editor with syntax highlighting and validation
Environment variable picker for sensitive values
Configuration templates for popular MCP servers (filesystem, git, etc.)
Guided setup wizard walks through configuration steps
Configuration testing with detailed error messages
Import/export configurations in multiple formats
Configuration history with rollback
user_stories: As a developer, I want visual MCP configuration so that I don't have to edit JSON manually
As a user, I want setup wizards so that I can configure MCP servers without documentation

features.title: Multi-User Team Support
features.description: Enable multiple users to work within a shared workspace with proper access controls. Implement team invitations, member management, and shared resources.
features.rationale: Multi-tenant support is a known gap that limits team adoption. Teams need to collaborate on agents while maintaining appropriate access controls.
acceptance_criteria: Create team workspaces with unique identifiers
Invite users to teams via email or link
Role-based access within teams (admin, editor, viewer)
Agents, skills, and MCP servers can be team-scoped
Team activity feed shows recent changes
Team settings management for admins
Leave team and transfer ownership workflows
user_stories: As a team lead, I want to invite my team members so that we can collaborate on agents
As a user, I want to share agents with my team so that others can use and improve them

features.title: Resource Access Control
features.description: Implement fine-grained access control for agents, skills, flows, and MCP servers. Allow resource owners to set visibility and edit permissions.
features.rationale: As teams grow, they need granular control over who can access and modify resources. This prevents accidental changes and protects sensitive configurations.
acceptance_criteria: Resources have owner, visibility (private/team/public), and permission settings
Share dialog allows granular permission assignment
Permission inheritance from team defaults
Access audit log shows who accessed what
Batch permission updates for multiple resources
Permission conflicts are detected and reported
user_stories: As a developer, I want to control who can edit my agents so that I prevent unauthorized changes
As a team admin, I want to audit access so that I ensure compliance with policies

features.title: Agent Collaboration & Chaining
features.description: Enable agents to call other agents as sub-tasks, creating powerful agent chains. Support parallel and sequential agent orchestration with output passing.
features.rationale: Agent collaboration/chaining is a known gap that limits complex workflow capabilities. Users need to compose sophisticated solutions from simpler agents.
acceptance_criteria: Agent configuration includes 'callable agents' that can be invoked
Output from one agent can be passed as input to another
Parallel execution of multiple sub-agents supported
Chain execution visualization shows flow and status
Error handling at chain level with fallback options
Chain templates for common patterns
Performance metrics for chain executions
user_stories: As a developer, I want to chain agents so that complex tasks are broken into manageable pieces
As a user, I want parallel agent execution so that I can speed up multi-part workflows

features.title: Workflow Sharing & Export
features.description: Allow users to export and share workflows (flows) with others. Include import validation, conflict resolution, and dependency bundling.
features.rationale: Workflow sharing accelerates adoption and enables best practice distribution. Users want to share their successful workflows with the community.
acceptance_criteria: Export flows as standalone JSON packages
Dependencies (agents, skills) bundled in export
Import validation checks for missing dependencies
Conflict resolution UI for existing resources
Public sharing via unique URLs
Usage tracking for shared workflows
Version compatibility checking on import
user_stories: As a developer, I want to share my workflows so that others can benefit from my work
As a user, I want to import community workflows so that I can use proven solutions

features.title: Enterprise SSO Integration
features.description: Add single sign-on support for enterprise identity providers including SAML, OIDC, and popular services like Okta, Azure AD, and Google Workspace.
features.rationale: Enterprise customers require SSO for security compliance and user management. This is a gate for enterprise adoption.
acceptance_criteria: SAML 2.0 SSO integration with major identity providers
OIDC support for modern authentication flows
Just-in-time provisioning creates users on first login
Group mapping syncs identity provider groups to team roles
SSO-only mode disables local authentication
Admin configuration UI for SSO settings
SSO session management and timeout handling
user_stories: As an enterprise admin, I want SSO so that users authenticate with our company identity
As a user, I want to log in with my work account so that I don't need another password

features.title: Comprehensive Audit Logging
features.description: Implement detailed audit logging for all user actions, API calls, and system events. Support log export, retention policies, and compliance reporting.
features.rationale: Enterprise and regulated environments require audit trails for compliance. Audit logs are essential for security investigation and operational visibility.
acceptance_criteria: All user actions are logged with actor, action, timestamp, and context
API calls are logged with request/response metadata
Searchable audit log viewer with filtering
Export logs in common formats (JSON, CSV, SIEM)
Configurable retention policies
Tamper-evident log storage
Real-time audit event streaming for SIEM integration
user_stories: As a security admin, I want audit logs so that I can investigate security incidents
As a compliance officer, I want log exports so that I can meet regulatory requirements

features.title: Plugin System
features.description: Create an extensible plugin architecture allowing custom tool integrations, UI components, and workflow nodes. Include plugin marketplace discovery.
features.rationale: Extensibility through plugins enables the community to build specialized integrations. This multiplies the platform's capabilities without core development.
acceptance_criteria: Plugin API for registering custom tools and UI components
Sandboxed plugin execution for security
Plugin lifecycle management (install, update, uninstall)
Plugin discovery from community registry
Plugin settings and configuration UI
Version compatibility checking
Plugin development documentation and SDK
user_stories: As a developer, I want to create plugins so that I can add custom functionality
As a user, I want to install plugins so that I can extend capabilities without coding

features.title: API Rate Limiting & Quotas
features.description: Implement API rate limiting and usage quotas at user, team, and system levels. Include quota management UI, usage alerts, and enforcement policies.
features.rationale: Production deployments need rate limiting to prevent abuse and manage costs. Quotas help teams budget API usage and prevent runaway costs.
acceptance_criteria: Configurable rate limits per endpoint and user
Usage quotas for API calls, tokens, and executions
Quota usage dashboard with projections
Email alerts at quota thresholds
Soft and hard limit enforcement options
Admin override capabilities for rate limits
Quota reset schedules (daily, weekly, monthly)
user_stories: As an admin, I want to set usage quotas so that teams operate within budget
As a user, I want usage alerts so that I know before hitting limits

features.title: Workflow Marketplace
features.description: Create a community marketplace for discovering, sharing, and rating workflows, templates, and plugins. Include moderation, ratings, and installation tracking.
features.rationale: A marketplace creates network effects that increase platform value. Users benefit from community contributions, and contributors get recognition.
acceptance_criteria: Browse and search marketplace listings
Submit workflows and plugins for listing
Rating and review system
Installation count and popularity tracking
Moderation queue for submissions
Featured and trending sections
Publisher profiles and verification
user_stories: As a user, I want to discover community workflows so that I can find solutions to my problems
As a contributor, I want to publish my work so that I can help others and gain recognition
